page.title: 07BUILDER, WHITTON
page.content: Ernest Hoskins left school in 1944 and started work for his father who was a wheelwright and undertaker. Here he learnt carpentry and joinery. In 1973 he started his own business as a general builder. His main work is repairs, plumbing and building extensions. He also makes all his own windows, doors etc.in his workshop. The woods he uses there are mostly oak,froko and other red woods, and most soft woods.The machinery in his workshop consists of: electric planer,morticer,sanders,routers,saws and hand planers. He works within a radius of 20 miles, often working long hours and weekends as he is a self-employed man.
